label: Hyperovulation
hint_text: any hormone therapy used to stimulate ovulation

label: IVF/GIFT etc.
hint_text: any method of in-vitro fertilisation. Includes in-vitro fertilisation, gamete intra- fallopian transfer(GIFT), zygote intra fallopian transfer, etc.

label: Other
hint_text: other infertility treatment not mentioned above, including artificial insemination.

hint_text: information not available.

label: Aboriginal
hint_text: is a person of Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander descent who identifies as an Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander and is accepted as such by the community in which she lives. If yes, must answer 'Indigenous Status'.

label: Asian
hint_text: all whose ethnic background originates from the countries of Asia, South East Asia and Indian subcontinent. For example, Fijian Indian.

label: Caucasian
hint_text: all of Caucasoid heritage, including European, Russian, Middle Eastern and Arabic.

label: Other
hint_text: includes African Negroes, American Blacks and Indians and Inuit. There is a separate category for Pacific Islander and Maori.

label: Pacific Islander
hint_text: all from Pacific Islander background, including Samoan, Cook Islands Maori, Niuean, Tokelauan, and other Pacific Islands groups e.g., Hawaiian, Tahitian. Excludes Maori.

label: Maori
hint_text: a person of New Zealand Maori descent who identifies as Maori.

label: Unknown
hint_text: information not available.

label: Aboriginal but not Torres Strait Islander origin
Torres Strait Islander but not Aboriginal origin
Aboriginal and Torres Strait Island origin
Neither Aboriginal nor Torres Strait Islander origin
Unknown
hint_text: Information not available

label: Booked at tertiary obstetric hospital
hint_text: Mother booked into a hospital with a neonatal intensive care unit and was not transferred during the most recent admission.

label: In-utero transfer from obstetric hospital
hint_text: Mother transferred during most recent admission, baby in utero.

label: Ex-utero retrieval
hint_text: Baby transferred from any other hospital by a retrieval team with specialist neonatal training, using appropriate equipment. This includes transfers by NETS and WANTS.

label: Ex-utero transfer
hint_text: Baby transferred from any other hospital by a non specialist transfer method. This includes transport by ambulance.

label: Other
hint_text: Includes born in transit, not booked.

label: Booked at this level II unit
hint_text: Mother booked into this non-tertiary hospital, no neonatal intensive care unit (for level II units only).

label: In-utero transfer to this level II unit
hint_text: Mother transferred during most recent admission, baby in utero (for level II units only).

label: Ex-utero retrieval to this level II unit
hint_text: Baby retrieved from any other hospital by a specialist neonatal transport retrieval team using appropriate equipment (for level II units only).

label: Ex-utero transfer to this level II unit
hint_text: Baby transferred from any other hospital, by a non-specialist transfer method. This includes transport by ambulance (for level II units only).

label: Unknown
hint_text: Information not available.

label: Preterm pre-labour rupture of membranes
hint_text: Confirmed spontaneous rupture of membrane (ROM) occurring prior to the onset of labour, and before 37 completed weeks' gestation. ROM is defined as the obvious gush of clear amniotic fluid from the vagina, or (if fluid is available) by differentiation with urine and vaginal secretions.

label: Preterm labour
hint_text: The presence of regular painful contractions, leading to progressive effacement and dilatation of the cervix, eventually leading to the birth of the baby, and commencing before 37 completed weeks' gestation.

label: Hypertension in pregnancy
hint_text: A systolic blood pressure >=140 mmHg and/or diastolic blood pressure >=90 mmHg, or a rise in systolic blood pressure >=25 mmHg and/or a rise in diastolic blood pressure >=15 mmHg from blood pressure reading before conception or in the first trimester (confirmed by two readings six hours apart).

label: Antpartum haemorrhage
hint_text: Significant haemorrhage in the time from 200 weeks gestation to the end of second stage of labour. Excludes a 'show'.

label: Suspected intrauterine growth restriction
hint_text: A condition where this fetus fails to reach its genetically predetermined full growth potential due to intrinsic or extrinsic factors. Based on more than one obstetric ultrasound.

label: Fetal distress
hint_text: Any 'distress' or compromise of this fetus leading to intervention by the obstetric team.

label: Other
hint_text: Other significant antenatal complication, not specified.

label: None
hint_text: No presenting problem. Baby must be born at term.

label: Antenatal diagnosis of fetal malformation
hint_text: Fetal malformation diagnosed prior to birth by any method. This prenatal diagnosis may or may not be confirmed after birth.

label: Unknown
hint_text: Presenting problem is unknown.

label: No, labour did not commence in the preterm period
Yes, labour commenced in the preterm period
No intrauterine growth restriction present or suspected
Yes, intrauterine growth restriction was present or suspected
Yes, obstetric intervention required for fetal compromise
No fetal malformation detected prior to birth
Yes, fetal malformation detected prior to birth
Unknown
hint_text: Information not available.

label: None
hint_text: Corticosteroids not ever given during this pregnancy at a time likely to enhance fetal lung maturation.

label: Incomplete, less than 24 hours
hint_text: First dose given at less than 24 hours prior to this baby's birth.

label: Complete
hint_text: More than one dose of corticosteroids give, and first dose was given more than 24 hours and the last dose less than 8 days before baby's birth.

label: More than 7 days
hint_text: Steroids given more than 7 days before the baby's birth. If two courses given, and one is 'complete', use complete.

label: Unknown
hint_text: Information not available.

MgSO4 given as IM injection within 6 hrs of birth

MgSO4 given but details not known

hint_text: Born in a hospital without a level III neonatal intensive care nursery.

label: Home birth
hint_text: Birth planned for and occurred at home.

label: Born before arrival
hint_text: Born at home (unplanned event), or in an ambulance, or any other area outside a hospital with obstetric facilities.

label: Vaginal
hint_text: Vaginal birth, includes vaginal breech.

label: Instrument
hint_text: Vaginal birth using instrument, includes forceps, rotations, and vacuum extractions.

label: Caesarean section in labour
hint_text: Caesarean performed after the commencement of labour (regular painful contractions, leading to progressive effacement and dilatation of cervix, eventually leading to the birth of the baby).

label: Caesarean section, no labour
hint_text: Caesarean section performed prior to labour commencing.

Yes, intubation necessary in labour ward

Unknown. All of the above anomaly fields are filled, but there might be more.
Normal
hint_text: No respiratory disease noted; no respiratory support given.

label: Non-specific
hint_text: Any non-specific respiratory distress in term or preterm babies requiring support (includes superseded categories of Transient tachypnoea of the newborn [02] and Immature lung [07] and aspiration of amniotic fluid or blood.

label: Hyaline membrane disease
hint_text: Increasing respiratory distress or oxygen requirements, or need for ventilator support from the first six hours of life with a chest x-ray showing generalised reticulo-granular pattern, with or without air bronchogram. This is normally a five day illness and babies who are treated with surfactant who have no respiratory illness beyond 24 hours of age probably did not have HMD in the first place and should be coded as having non-specific respiratory distress.

label: Meconium aspiration
hint_text: Respiratory distress presenting from immediately after birth to 12 hours of age. Hypoxia, tachypnoea, gasping respirations, and often signs of underlying asphyxia. Chest x-ray shows over-expansion of lungs with widespread coarse, fluffy infiltrates. Infants who require respiratory support for <24 hours should not be coded as MAS. They should be coded as non-specific respiratory disease.

label: Pneumonia
hint_text: Respiratory distress with proven or suspected infection(toxic blood count), and chest x-ray showing persisting opacities.

label: Persistent primary pulmonary hypertension (without co-existing lung disease)
hint_text: Echo cardiac (shunting) or clinical evidence, oxygen requirement unexplained by chest x-ray or loud P2, or differential pre and post-ductal TCPO2.

label: Apnoea
hint_text: Recurrent pauses in breathing of more than 20 seconds, or for less than 20 seconds and associated with bradycardia (heart rate <100) or desaturation requiring intervention.

label: Congenital malformation
hint_text: Congenital malformation was the primary reason for respiratory distress, e.g. diaphragmatic hernia - must also be listed under congenital malformation field.

label: Other
hint_text: Unspecified other respiratory disease.

label: Peri-surgical
hint_text: Indication fro respiratory support is surgical intervention. Must also be listed under Neonatal surgery field.

label: Newborn encephalopathy/Hypoxic ischemic encephalopathy
hint_text: A clinically defined syndrome of disturbed neurological function in an baby with difficulties in initiating and maintaining respiration, depression of tone and reflexes, subnormal level of consciousness and often with seizures. Birth asphyxia should be included here. Metabolic Encephalopathy +/- seizures due to metabolic disturbance such as hypoglycaemia, hyponatraemia, hypernatraemia, hypocalcaemia or CNS infection(meningitis or encephalitis) should not be included, it should be coded as 10.

hint_text: Ultrasound/post mortem shows no haemorrhage.

label: Grade 1
hint_text: Subependymal germinal matrix haemorrhage.

label: Grade 2
hint_text: Intraventricular haemorrhage with no ventricular distension.

label: Grade 3
hint_text: Intraventricular haemorrhage with ventricle distended with blood.

label: Grade 4
hint_text: Intraparenchymal haemorrhage.

label: Not examined
hint_text: by ultrasound or by post mortem examination.

label: No dilatation
hint_text: Ventricle size is less than or equal to 97th centile.

label: Dilatation
hint_text: Ventricles size >97th centile for gestation, but <= 4mm.

label: Hydrocephalus
hint_text: Ventricles size is >4mm (larger than 97th centile for gestation) or hydrocephalus present that required s shunt or any form of drainage (permanent or transient).

label: Unknown
hint_text: Information not available, includes not scanned.

label: No cysts
hint_text: No cystic lesions seen on ultrasound

label: Porencephalic cyst(s)
hint_text: Parenchymal lesions corresponding to grade 4 intraventricular haemorrhage.

label: Periventricular leukomalacia
hint_text: Refers to the ischemic brain injury affecting the periventricular white matter in the boundary zones supplied by terminal branches of the both the centripetal and centrifugal arteries.

label: Encephaloclastic porencephaly
hint_text: Relatively late development of extensive echo-dense and cystic lesions involving the periphery of the cerebrum.

label: Unknown
hint_text: Information not available, includes not scanned.

label: No, baby did not meet local criteria for an examination of eyes

hint_text: Examined, no changes seen.

label: Stage I
hint_text: Demarcation line separating avascular from vascular retinal regions.

label: Stage II
hint_text: Ridge - demarcation line increased in volume to extend out of the plane of the retina.

label: Stage III
hint_text: Ridge with extra retinal fibrovascular proliferation. May be continuous with posterior edge of ridge or posterior but disconnected from the ridge, or into the vitreous.

label: Stage IV
hint_text: Retinal detachment. In Stage IV the detachment is subtotal, and for Stage V there is total detachment.

label: Not examined
hint_text: No eye examination performed.
